definition: to guard against the unexpected (idiom); just in case/prepared for any eventualities
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: Raj :Oh, we should have a plan in case one of us gets lucky.
sentences.chinese: 噢，我们得制定个计划以防万一我们中有谁走桃花运。

sentences.english: But she kept overfeeding her cat just in case.
sentences.chinese: 但是她一直过量地喂着她的猫，以防万一。

sentences.english: These were extra wedges in case they should be needed.
sentences.chinese: 这些额外的木楔是以防万一的。

sentences.english: I took the precaution of locking money in the safe.
sentences.chinese: 我把所有的钱都锁在保险箱里以防万一。

sentences.english: You pay the money just case. ( in )
sentences.chinese: 你花钱购买保险只是以防万一。

sentences.english: Even the ring was attached to a rope, just in case.
sentences.chinese: 甚至戒指都绑上了绳子，以防万一。

sentences.english: I took the precaution of locking everything in the safe.
sentences.chinese: 我把一切东西都锁在保险箱里以防万一。

sentences.english: You'd bring along the invincible spear-head with you to be safe.
sentences.chinese: 那你要记得带着这只铁枪头以防万一。

sentences.english: We make sure we're always well stocked up with candles just in case.
sentences.chinese: 我们要确保时刻备足蜡烛，以防万一。

sentences.english: Residents along the coast were evacuated as a precaution.
sentences.chinese: 为了以防万一，沿海居民们均被隔离。

sentences.english: It is fine, but I carried an umbrella just in case.
sentences.chinese: 天气晴朗，但我还是带了一把伞以防万一。

sentences.english: We bought salt ines by the case.
sentences.chinese: 为了以防万一我们还买了咸盐饼干。

sentences.english: Ignore that red string, that is just a safety.
sentences.chinese: 先别理红色细绳，那是以防万一。

sentences.english: As a precaution, put them in an airtight freezer bag.
sentences.chinese: 以防万一，将它们储存在密闭冷藏袋吧。

sentences.english: Crits and comments welcome. I'll get my asbestos gear out just in case .
sentences.chinese: 我将得到我的石绵以齿轮连起出仅仅以防万一。

sentences.english: I always carry some medicine with me whenever I’m traveling, just to be on the safe side.
sentences.chinese: 旅行时，我总是随身带着药，以防万一。

definition: motive/purpose/(sth) being the motive or purpose
Preparedness averts peril./to be prepared, just in case (idiom)
a possible period of want or need
to fool people (idiom)/to pull the wool over people's eyes
(so as) to avoid/to prevent/(just) in case
to act with urgency/to buy time
Wanquan county in Zhangjiakou 張家口|张家口[Zhang1 jia1 kou3], Hebei
see 防患未然[fang2 huan4 wei4 ran2]
